string-array.name: nevsky
string-array.item: St. Alexander Nevsky Cathedral is a Bulgarian Orthodox cathedral. Built in Neo-Byzantine style, it serves as the cathedral church of the Patriarch of Bulgaria, the biggest one in the country and second largest in the Balkans. The Cathedral occupies an area of 3,170 sq m and accommodates 10,000 people. Its magnificent silhoutte, lavish ornamentation, masterpieces of iconpainting and great acoustics make its one of Sofia great attractions.
1, St. Alexander Nevski Square, Sofia 1000. \nLocation 42.695791,23.332723 (Click to see on the map)
